name: argent
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ after noun ] used to describe something on a coat of arms (= a special shield or shield-shaped pattern that is the sign of a family, university, or city) that is silver or white: His crest is a castle argent.
literary silver or silver-white in colour: The grey skies were touched by jagged, argent fingers of lightning.
More examplesFewer examplesHenry VII used either a dragon gules and a greyhound argent, two greyhounds argent, or a lion.He groped for his shield (a mitre argent on a sable field).The arms are a lion rampant argent on a chief azure.I saw her argent eyes flicking from face to face.He dreamed of the argent stars of his childhood.
